entities.name: olympé
entities.description: Olympe is a person who had a conversation with the narrator and Hagrid. She is mentioned as 'an' Olympe talked it over an' we agreed'. (CHAPTER  TWENTY)

entities.name: golgomath
entities.description: Golgomath is a person who was considered to be a Gurg. He is mentioned as 'the Gurg looked like favorin' You-Know-Who didn’ mean all of ’em would'. (CHAPTER  TWENTY)

entities.name: you-know-who
entities.description: You-Know-Who is a person who was favored by the Gurg. He is mentioned as 'the Gurg looked like favorin' You-Know-Who didn’ mean all of ’em would'. (CHAPTER  TWENTY)

entities.name: hagrid
entities.description: Hagrid is a person who had a conversation with the narrator and Olympe. He is mentioned as 'an' we agreed, jus’ ’cause the Gurg looked like favorin’ You-Know-Who didn’ mean all of ’em would'. (CHAPTER  TWENTY)

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is a person who asked Hagrid questions. He is mentioned as '“How could you tell which ones they were?” asked Ron.' (CHAPTER  TWENTY)

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is a person who had told Hagrid and the narrator not to tangle with Death Eaters. He is mentioned as 'Dumbledore had told us before we wen’ not ter tangle with ’em if we could avoid it,' (CHAPTER  TWENTY)

entities.name: death eaters
entities.description: Death Eaters are a group of people who were known to the narrator and Hagrid. They are mentioned as 'the trouble was they knew we was around — ’spect Golgomath told him abou’'. (CHAPTER  TWENTY)

entities.name: golgomath
entities.description: Golgomath is a person who had told Dumbledore about the narrator and Hagrid. He is mentioned as 'the trouble was they knew we was around — ’spect Golgomath told him abou’'. (CHAPTER  TWENTY)

relationships.description: Hagrid and Olympe had a conversation about the Gurg. They are mentioned as 'an' Olympe talked it over an' we agreed'. (CHAPTER  TWENTY)
Hagrid considered Golgomath to be a Gurg. He is mentioned as 'the Gurg looked like favorin' You-Know-Who didn’ mean all of ’em would'. (CHAPTER  TWENTY)
You-Know-Who was favored by the Gurg, which Hagrid considered. He is mentioned as 'the Gurg looked like favorin' You-Know-Who didn’ mean all of ’em would'. (CHAPTER  TWENTY)
Hagrid had a conversation with Ron about the giants. They are mentioned as '“You went poking around dark ca ves looking for giants?” said Ron' (CHAPTER  TWENTY)
Hagrid was advised by Dumbledore not to tangle with Death Eaters. He is mentioned as 'Dumbledore had told us before we wen’ not ter tangle with ’em if we could avoid it,' (CHAPTER  TWENTY)
Hagrid and the narrator knew about the Death Eaters. They are mentioned as 'the trouble was they knew we was around — ’spect Golgomath told him abou’'. (CHAPTER  TWENTY)
Golgomath had told Dumbledore about the narrator and Hagrid. He is mentioned as 'the trouble was they knew we was around — ’spect Golgomath told him abou’'. (CHAPTER  TWENTY)
